DataElement.preferredName: Patient Medication Agreement During On Protocol Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria IND
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator used to confirm patients eligibility for the clinical study based on medication agreement during protocol therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Medication Agreement During On Protocol Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._At some point in a given period of time._Subject is receiving treatment based on protocol._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Medication Agreement During On Protocol Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._At some point in a given period of time._Subject is receiving treatment based on protocol._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.
At some point in a given period of time.
Subject is receiving treatment based on protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient understand and agree to outlined material in the consent form?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient understand and agree to as part of the consent process they must refrain from driving a motor vehicle or operating heavy machinery while receiving study drug and for 30 days from the date of the last study drug administration.
